intro: Spiradiclis longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract spiradiclis, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, yellow flowers with prominent bracts. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or grassy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
